Manage complex rights operations, including data collection for new releases, rights declarations, and payment tracking related to neighboring rights and mechanical reproduction rights.

Respond to high-level inquiries from third parties and internal teams, providing expert guidance on rights issues.

Support strategic initiatives to optimize the rights management processes and improve operational efficiency.
Mentor and train junior team members, sharing expertise and best practices.

About the job
Role: Analyst â€“ Urban Sanitation

Location: Mumbai

Experience: 2â€“4 years

About Dasra:

Dasraâ€™s bold aspiration is a transformed India where a billion thrive with dignity and equity. Established in 1999, Dasra is Indiaâ€™s leading strategic philanthropy foundation, working with philanthropists and high impact social entrepreneurs to bring together knowledge, funding and talent as a catalyst for social change. Dasra nurtures strategic philanthropy for India and focuses on impactful programs such as empowering adolescent girls, urban sanitation, inclusive economies and child protection and care. With 25 years of experience in the sector, a depth of knowledge gained from working with and supporting over 1,000 non-profits and having brought $200 million in funding to organizations - Dasra drives collaborative action to accelerate social change in India.

Dasra embraces diversity across people and communities through multiplicity in composition integrated with structures, culture and policies, enhancing inclusion and belonging for all in letter and spirit. We envision a team that includes people across caste, religion, gender, economic status, geography, disability and other underrepresented communities, supported by organizational structures that enable collective, transparent and fair decision making, guided by policies that facilitate growth and authenticity within an environment of openness and listening.

We believe that GEDI in our institutional and programmatic endeavours will enhance, drive and accelerate social impact and social change through an integration of the worldviews of the most marginalized, recognition of their vulnerabilities, rights and potentials and through prioritization of their needs.

About OneDasra Team:

Dasra achieves its ambitious mission with a collaborative 200+ member OneDasra team. This team works on various programs and supports audacious impact-first goals and strategic objectives by collaborating with internal and external stakeholders. The OneDasra organization structure has enhanced agility, learning and enables pushing professional boundaries, which ensures that talent grows and develops, for greater systems change. The recruitment process is unique in that you will be selected to join OneDasra, with a role that best leverages your strengths and be involved in programs that align with your current interests. You will not be joining a siloed-functional team, therefore â€“ please consider these outlined responsibilities and skill-sets required with an opportunistic role that will build cross functionality and be well poised for individual learning, growth and development across sectors and stakeholders. Dasra is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About the Dasraâ€™s Urban WASH Portfolio & NFSSM Alliance:

The Dasra Urban Water Hygiene and Sanitation Team plays the role of the field catalyzer to bring together funders, governments, communities and sector experts. Dasraâ€™s aspiration is by 2030, to enable Safe Sanitation and Water for Urban India (~7900+ Cities) thereby enabling dignity and equity to our most vulnerable. Dasra is the Secretariat of the NFSSM Alliance and supports the overall functioning of the Alliance by fostering collaboration between 35+ diverse expert organizations focused on creating policy recommendations and collaborative action towards safe and sustainable human waste management in India. We work with our network of partners in over 19 states to develop policy recommendations, support governments through evidence and best practices and funnel up voices of communities, with a focus on institutionalizing inclusive Sanitation, Climate and Sanitation interlinkages, and creating an enabling environment for innovation and technology.

Dasra anchors a collaborative platform for WSH - the National Faecal Sludge and Septage Management Alliance (NFSSM Alliance), which was convened in 2016 with support of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. The Alliance is a group of 35+ sanitation experts in India that build consensus and drive discourse around Faecal Sludge Management and inclusive sanitation to support national, state and city governments. The NFSSM Alliance works in collaboration with government stakeholders like the Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs, NITI Aayog and the Central Finance Commission.

Role Overview

We are seeking a proactive and mission-driven Analyst to support the design and delivery of the WASH teamâ€™s Alliance priorities and state-specific work. This role is ideal for someone with 2â€“4 years of experience who brings strong project management, stakeholder engagement, research and analysis, and strategic thinking skills to the table.

You will play a key role in ensuring effective execution of programs, driving sector collaboration, and contributing to thought leadership on inclusive urban sanitation.

Key Responsibilities

Project Ownership: Independently manage and deliver workstreams under different outcomes â€“ from planning and execution to reporting and impact tracking. 
Stakeholder Engagement: Coordinate closely with government stakeholders, funders, and sector experts to support team goals. 
Knowledge Platforms: Drive the planning and execution of Alliance convenings and task forces, ensuring rich cross-learning, follow-through on actions, and strategic alignment. 
Research & Insights: Develop evidence-based outputs, including memos, briefs, presentations â€“ through structured research, stakeholder inputs, and data synthesis. 
Internal Coordination: Collaborate with cross-functional Dasra teams to ensure timely delivery and maintain high standards of quality, accuracy, and responsiveness. 
Team Contribution: Support junior team members and contribute to building team culture, knowledge systems, and operational processes. 

Who You Are

2â€“4 years of work experience in strategic and stakeholder driven roles including consulting, WASH, ecosystem building, or related areas. 
Strong project and time management skills, able to juggle multiple priorities and deliver independently. 
Excellent written and verbal communication, including the ability to create clear and compelling documents for diverse stakeholders. 
Experience in engaging with government stakeholders or working in multi-stakeholder environments is highly desirable. 
Brings strong critical thinking, analytical ability, and attention to detail. 
A motivated self-starter who thrives in dynamic, mission-driven environments. 
Passionate about solving for urban development. 

Good to have skills/ experience:

Experience with primary and secondary research, or basic data analytics
Familiarity with urban governance, sanitation, or climate resilience 
Exposure to donor engagement or fundraising processes

About the job
At Roche you can show up as yourself, embraced for the unique qualities you bring. Our culture encourages personal expression, open dialogue, and genuine connections, where you are valued, accepted and respected for who you are, allowing you to thrive both personally and professionally. This is how we aim to prevent, stop and cure diseases and ensure everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Join Roche, where every voice matters.

The Position

IT Business Analyst - GenAI/Automation

In Roche Informatics, we build on Roche's 125-year history as one of the world's largest biotech companies, globally recognized for providing transformative innovative solutions across major disease areas. We combine human capabilities with cutting-edge technological innovations to do now what our patients need next. Our commitment to our patients' needs motivates us to deliver technology that evolves the practice of medicine.

Role Overview: 

As an IT Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in delivering innovative and scalable solutions that drive business value. You will manage the solution lifecycle, ensure alignment with business requirements, and act as a bridge between business and IT functions. This role reports to the Section Lead - Product Analysis & Consultancy - APAC.

You will be:

Actively manage the product lifecycle to ensure solutions meet business requirements and align with the product roadmap
Take on additional roles such as IT Business Partner, Product Manager, or Squad Lead when needed
Develop and maintain business cases, including solution options, resource estimates, and support for strategic backlog management. Serve as an interface between business and IT, leading the initiative scoping phase and driving the launch of new projects
Perform typical Business Analysis activities and create deliverables according to Roche standards, such as Business Cases, Project Charters, and URS/User Stories. Collaborate with delivery and project teams to ensure the final solution meets user requirements and is delivered on schedule
Support risk management activities and ensure compliance with quality standards. Assist in implementing new practices like agile methodologies and contribute to process improvements and automation

Who you are :

Having 6-8 years of experience in analyzing business processes and identifying opportunities for improvement and automation
You are familiar with automation technologies such as GenAI and LLM, and the ability to navigate related activities. You possess strong communication, logical, and critical thinking skills, with experience in prompt writing and management in an enterprise environment. You have experience working with data scientists and a solid understanding of data analysis techniques. Ability to work with data to develop hypotheses and identify automation opportunities
Good strong interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with stakeholders, data scientists, and development teams
Have proven ability to solve business problems involving multiple stakeholders in a matrix organization. You are a Quick learner with the ability to adapt to new technologies and methodologies
You have experience in a regulated industry (preferably healthcare) with Pharmacovigilance experience preferred

Who we are

A healthier future drives us to innovate. Together, more than 100â€™000 employees across the globe are dedicated to advance science, ensuring everyone has access to healthcare today and for generations to come. Our efforts result in more than 26 million people treated with our medicines and over 30 billion tests conducted using our Diagnostics products. We empower each other to explore new possibilities, foster creativity, and keep our ambitions high, so we can deliver life-changing healthcare solutions that make a global impact.

Letâ€™s build a healthier future, together.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Additional Comments

Business Analyst Location: Offshore (Kochi, Trivandrum, Chennai) Type: Full-time Role Overview As a Business Analyst, youâ€™ll partner with Health Plans, external vendors, and cross-functional teams to translate complex US healthcare business needs into detailed requirements for our Enrollment and Billing platforms. Youâ€™ll cover everything from member onboarding through premium billing reconciliation, ensuring compliance with CMS rules, HIPAA, and industry standards. Key Responsibilities 1. Enrollment Stream

 Groups & Sub-Groups Configuration: Define plan structures, benefit groupings, and sub-group hierarchies.
 Member Lifecycle Management: Gather requirements for New Applications, Plan Benefit Period (PBP) Changes, Disenrollments, Reinstatements, and Membership Updates.
 Eligibility & Enrollment Transactions: Specify inbound/outbound EDI (834, 270/271), AppOut/MembershipOut files, and CMS-mandated reporting.
 Work Queues & Exception Handling: Model Work, Process, and Rejection Queues (including BEQ), and build requirements for automatic routing and SLA tracking.
 Provider & PCP Integrations: Document interfaces to provider directories, PCP assignment engines, PBMs, and claims adjudication systems.
 Vendor File Management: Define ingestion and validation for external vendor feeds (network updates, pharmacy eligibility, premium billing).
 Correspondence & Communications: Capture requirements for letters, invoices, extracts, and digital notifications.
 Regulatory Reporting & Analytics: Elicit requirements for CMS compliance reports, LIS/LEP calculations, and custom dashboards. 2. Billing Stream
 Claims-to-Cash Workflows: Define end-to-end processes for Payment, Invoice, Retro-Billing, LIS/LEP adjustments, PWO (Premium Withhold Override), and DTRR reconciliation.
 Transaction Standards: Specify EDI (835ERAs, 820 Payment Orders, 277CA), ACH files, MMR/MPWR feeds, and XML-based invoice PDFs.
 Invoice Generation & Posting: Document rules for auto-posting, manual adjustments, and multi-LOB invoicing across Commercial, MA, and Medicaid.
 Reconciliation & Reporting: Model data flows for financial reconciliation, exception-driven reruns, and audit-ready reporting. 3. Analysis & Documentation
 Lead discovery sessionsâ€”workshops, storyboards, use-casesâ€”to capture granular business rules.
 Create process maps, swim-lane diagrams, data-mapping matrices, and requirement traceability matrices.
 Author BRDs, FRDs, user stories, acceptance criteria, and test-case templates.
 Partner with QA to validate end-to-end scenarios, edge cases, and compliance checks. 4. Stakeholder Engagement & Continuous Improvement
 Facilitate alignment across onshore/offshore teams, operations, vendor partners, and CMS contacts.
 Drive retrospectives to refine requirements-gathering processes, stemming root-cause analysis of production exceptions (e.g., DTRR, premium anomalies).
 Mentor junior analysts on healthcare regulations, EDI standards, and best practices. You Bring
 7+ years as a BA in US healthcare Enrollment and/or Billing systems.
 Deep expertise in CMS enrollment/disenrollment guidance, EDI (834/270/271, 835/820/277), DTRR, LIS/LEP, and provider network integrations.
 Strong analytical, process-modeling, and documentation skills (Visio/Miro, Jira/Aha).
 Excellent communication, stakeholder management, and facilitation abilities.
 Bachelorâ€™s degree in Business, Healthcare Informatics, or related field.
